AD_TeacherClass.synopsis: The teacher stalks the classroom, barking instruction, "encouragement", and dogma at his students.
AD_TeacherClass.how_to_trigger: Talk to the teacher in Youth Training. Resolve the Dialogue in any way.

Student03.synopsis: A malicious student watches the teacher beating Varrl, another student.
Student03.how_to_trigger:
Speak to Student03 before or after the gith boy scene.- goto 1387.51, -2.31, -769.13
- speak to Youth Zar'a'ath

AD_GithBoy_AssaultReaction.synopsis: Varrl's Assault reaction AD. He will say this when attacked and also when witnessing an attack, so writing must be applicable to both situations.
AD_GithBoy_AssaultReaction.how_to_trigger: Go to 1374; -2; -777It is clearer if there are no other characters around, so possilby attack one of the other Gith in the room and then use "Killcombat"Attack Varrl to trigger the AD.

Student02.synopsis: A fanatical student observes her teacher beating another student, then returns to her training.
Student02.how_to_trigger: Speak to Student02 before or after the gith boy scene.

AD_TeacherCombatStart.synopsis: Combat AD by Githyanki teacher Sa’varsh on the first turn of combat.

GithBoy.synopsis: If the Gith boy is unharmed, he can be persuaded to tell you about Orpheus, and subsequently to give you his copy of part of chapter 2.If he was stabbed (but not killed) by the player, the player can steal the chapter from him, or heal him and enter into the main conversation.
GithBoy.how_to_trigger: Talk to the Gith Boy in the training room after either you save him from the teacher, or perform a non-fatal stab.

PAD_TrainingDummyComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react tointeracting with the training dummies. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_TrainingDummyComment.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to 1364; 1; -751interact with any of the training dummiessee the AD play

Student04.synopsis: A malicious student watches the teacher beating Varrl, another student.
Student04.how_to_trigger: Speak to Student04 before or after the gith boy scene.

AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead.synopsis: Combat AD from Githyanki teacher Sa’varsh on his first turn after all students are dead.

AD_TeacherCombat_YouthDies.synopsis: Combat AD for Githyanki teacher Sa’varsh when a student dies.

PAD_AnatomicalSketchesComment.synopsis: If Lae'zel or GITH avatar is present they react to approaching the diagrams in the classroom. If they aren't present, some other party character reacts with generic comment.
PAD_AnatomicalSketchesComment.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to 1359; -1; -757see the AD play

AD_Student03Combat.how_to_trigger: Load up CRE_Main_Ago to 1359; 0; -768get into a combatYouth Zar’a’ath will speak the line in his first turn of combat.

GithBoy_Dead.synopsis: The boy speaks about the situation the player encountered, and his knowledge of Orpheus.
GithBoy_Dead.how_to_trigger: loadlevel CRE_Main_Ateleport S_CRE_GithBoykill GithBoy, killcombatoe debugbook > useful spells > speak with dead - debug > leaveuse spell.***for limit reached: oe Debug_SWD_LimitReached

AD_TeacherBeatingBoy.synopsis: Githyanki teacher (Sa'varsh) is beating one of his students, apparently for disobeying him. The boy is still questioning, aggravating the teacher further.
AD_TeacherBeatingBoy.how_to_trigger: Plays automatically while the teacher is beating up the boy.

Teacher.synopsis: The teacher puts the hurt boy in a deadly fight against another student. You can interfere and save the boy, kill him, or watch the events unfold.
Teacher.how_to_trigger: Talk to the teacher in the training room.

Student01.synopsis: A smug, bored student observes the Teacher beating Varrl (another student). Afterwards, they remove him if he has been killed/incapacitated.
Student01.how_to_trigger: Speak to Student 1 before or after the Teacher scene.

PAD_Combat_TeacherAbilityReaction.synopsis: PAD in combat on first Player turn after Sa’varsh casts Target_CRE_Savarsh_CombatInstruction

TeacherAfterBoyScene.synopsis: Following the conclusion of the Githboy scene, the player has a follow up interaction with the teacher where they comment on his methods, and the scene's outcome.
TeacherAfterBoyScene.how_to_trigger: Talk to the teacher after the GithBoy scene.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After analyzing the session descriptions, several ordering and exclusivity relations become apparent. First, in the teacher versus student sequence, the AD_TeacherBeatingBoy session (where the teacher is actively beating a student) logically happens just before the Teacher session (in which the teacher pits the hurt boy against another student). Furthermore, the TeacherAfterBoyScene is described as following the conclusion of the GithBoy scene, so the GithBoy session must occur before TeacherAfterBoyScene. In the combat part with the teacher, the AD_TeacherCombatStart session (which happens on the first turn of combat) precedes the PAD_Combat_TeacherAbilityReaction session (triggered on the first player turn after the teacher casts a combat ability). Additionally, the outcomes of the teacher–student combat lead to distinct dialogue paths: AD_TeacherCombat_YouthDies is triggered when a student dies, whereas AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead is triggered when all students are dead. Since these represent mutually exclusive outcomes, they cannot both occur in the same narrative path. Similarly, the GithBoy session and the GithBoy_Dead session are alternative outcomes – if the player saves or non-fatally stabs the boy, the GithBoy session is available; if the boy is killed, then GithBoy_Dead is triggered – and so both cannot occur together in one playthrough.

AD_TeacherClass_0.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherClass_0.text: Strike hard. Slice flesh. No hesitation.

AD_TeacherClass_1.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherClass_1.text: Mercy is death. Death is mercy. This is Vlaakith's will.

AD_TeacherClass_2.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherClass_2.text: You are well on your way to being ghaik food. Do. Better.

AD_TeacherClass_3.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherClass_3.text: Quicker! A ghaik would have smeared you across the floor by now!

Student03_0.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_0.text: I love fighting with daggers. It's so personal.

Student03_2.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_2.text: You're close enough to see the light go out behind their eyes.

Student03_1.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_1.text: You're not capable of joining our practice istik. Don't even try.

Student03_5.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_5.text: At this rate, there won't be anything left of him.

Student03_6.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_6.text: Come to join in the fun?

Student03_3.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_3.text: Wait your turn. If anyone's beating up Varrl next, it's me.

Student03_7.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_7.text: You don't look that strong, for someone who survived their training.

Student03_4.speaker: Youth Zar'a'ath
Student03_4.text: I'll help you practice if you like. I won't hurt you. Much.

Student02_1.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_1.text: Are you here to learn from our sa'varsh?

Student02_0.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_0.text: He's so powerful and wise. No wonder Vlaakith puts such faith in him.

Student02_2.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_2.text: I have to get on with my drills. I've already lost so much time.

Student02_4.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_4.text: Thrust, then parry. Or was it parry, then thrust?
Student02_4.context: NodeContext: Descriing the exercise, a bit lost

Student02_3.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_3.text: Even when we fail, we serve Vlaakith. Varrl's weakness will become our strength.

Student02_5.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_5.text: Sa'varsh Kethk is a wonderful teacher.

Student02_6.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_6.text: He'd happily help you improve your technique, istik.

Student02_7.speaker: Youth Astyl
Student02_7.text: I'm sorry you witnessed my failure, jhe'stil. Thank Vlaakith the sa'varsh is here to correct me.

AD_TeacherCombatStart_0.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherCombatStart_0.text: Take up your weapons! Do not fail me!

GithBoy_25.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_25.text: What have you done? You're no better than the sa'varsh.
GithBoy_25.context: NodeContext: scared but defiant - he just saw you kill his teacher/classmates.

GithBoy_29.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_29.text: Thank you, ra'stil. The sa'varsh would have left me there to die.

GithBoy_49.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_49.text: He's always telling us how we have to be ruthless, that death is the only mercy we deliver.

GithBoy_10.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_10.text: But you... You showed compassion, and kindness. You're just like - never mind.
GithBoy_10.context: NodeContext: Growing enthusiasm, then catches himself at the last moment

GithBoy_163.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_163.text: You - you've heard of him too?

GithBoy_166.speaker: Player
GithBoy_166.text: It wasn't a kindness. Vlaakith needs every sword against the ghaik, even yours.

GithBoy_4.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_4.text: Yes. Of course that's why you did it.

GithBoy_37.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_37.text: My sword will be ready. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!
GithBoy_37.context: NodeContext: Heart's not in it on the gith phrase

GithBoy_24.speaker: Player
GithBoy_24.text: I just keep believing I can be better. I hope you will do the same.

GithBoy_21.speaker: Player
GithBoy_21.text: Next time I won't be there to intervene. Tread carefully.

GithBoy_70.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_70.text: I will. Though every step I take feels like the wrong one.

GithBoy_153.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_153.text: If I refuse to kill, but get myself killed in the process then I still failed to prevent a death.

GithBoy_125.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_125.text: Morality is complex, jhe'stil, but I will keep trying to understand it. To understand him.
GithBoy_125.context: NodeContext: the 'him' is a mystery to the player, but idolised by the boy (his hero)

GithBoy_101.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_101.text: You mean, you know who he is?

GithBoy_86.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_86.text: He's so strong, and - and wise. And he rides a comet. A comet!

GithBoy_128.speaker: Player
GithBoy_128.text: Without this? Show the boy the chapter you stole.

GithBoy_20.speaker: Player
GithBoy_20.text: Wealth often clouds our moral judgement. I'd be happy to ease your burden...

GithBoy_199.speaker: Player
GithBoy_199.text: Tell me, who teaches you to question yourself so?

GithBoy_180.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_180.text: No one taught me. Not exactly.
GithBoy_180.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, not sure he should say anything

GithBoy_190.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_190.text: I've been reading about - about Orpheus. The true prince.

GithBoy_193.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_193.text: I know we're forbidden to talk about him. They say Vlaakith can hear you think his name.

GithBoy_126.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_126.text: I found his book... Part of it, anyway. I read it all the time. He's unbelievable.
GithBoy_126.context: NodeContext: Excited, sharing his secret passion

GithBoy_83.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_83.text: By Vlaakith's blade, child - Orpheus is a traitor to our queen. Shut your mouth before the crèche elders hear your words.

GithBoy_124.speaker: Player
GithBoy_124.text: Where did you get this book?

GithBoy_8.speaker: Player
GithBoy_8.text: I agree, it's a real page-turner. Show him the book you stole.

GithBoy_146.speaker: Player
GithBoy_146.text: 'Comet' you say? Like the one drawn on the portrait of Vlaakith?

GithBoy_71.speaker: Player
GithBoy_71.text: His symbol was drawn onto Vlaakith's portrait. Was that you?

GithBoy_87.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_87.context: NodeContext: Caught out, a bit embarassed

GithBoy_72.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_72.text: I wanted to know if there was anyone else here like me, someone who'd recognise it.
GithBoy_72.context: NodeContext: Growing a bit more enthusiastic, but holding back

GithBoy_192.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_192.text: I thought maybe I'd find a friend who'd want to talk about Orpheus. But nobody here cares about him.

GithBoy_204.speaker: Player
GithBoy_204.text: How did you get the book, if not from someone here?

GithBoy_165.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_165.text: A group of warriors came. Outsiders, on a mission for Vlaakith herself.

GithBoy_135.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_135.text: Sa'varsh Kethk made us clean their armour and... I found it, inside one of the breast plates.

GithBoy_198.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_198.text: I wish I knew who it belonged to - I have so many questions! Hopefully one day I'll find them.

GithBoy_121.speaker: Player
GithBoy_121.text: Sounds like quite the book. Can I have it?

GithBoy_201.speaker: Player
GithBoy_201.text: That book belongs to me, vin'iisk. Give it back.

GithBoy_60.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_60.text: It's yours? Of course! That's why you were so ready to help me.

GithBoy_44.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_44.text: I've kept it safe the whole time. There's not even a splash of blood on it!
GithBoy_44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boy hands over Orpheus Chapter 2 (unseen)

GithBoy_120.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_120.text: Where did you get it? What's your favourite line?
GithBoy_120.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - they don't want to have this conversation.

GithBoy_0.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_0.text: You're right. This isn't the time. Sa'varsh Kethk might hear us.
GithBoy_0.context: InternalNodeContext: Reacting to the player's reluctance to have this conversation.

GithBoy_174.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_174.text: It was an honour to carry his words so close to my heart. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.
GithBoy_174.context: NodeContext: As if saluting his hero

GithBoy_178.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_178.text: You're lying to me! Orpheus' words don't belong in the hands of someone so dishonest.
GithBoy_178.context: NodeContext: Sadness, turns to quiet outrage

GithBoy_141.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_141.text: Besides, I - I don't have it with me. So I can't.

GithBoy_78.speaker: Player
GithBoy_78.text: It's mine. Those warriors borrowed it from me.

GithBoy_202.speaker: Player
GithBoy_202.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your captain to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_18.speaker: Player
GithBoy_18.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_36.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_36.text: No! Please don't tell the sa'varsh - he'll kill me! Just take it.
GithBoy_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_145.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_145.text: I'm sorry. I will not fail him again. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!

GithBoy_30.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_30.text: Well, if you tell him about the book, then... then I'll tell him I got it from you!

GithBoy_106.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_106.text: And do you know what happens to outsiders who cause trouble in the crèche?

GithBoy_206.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_206.text: Nobody does. But I've seen Kith'rak Therezzyn's wolves chewing on the leftovers. So keep quiet.

GithBoy_95.speaker: Player
GithBoy_95.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

GithBoy_205.speaker: Player
GithBoy_205.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_56.speaker: Player
GithBoy_56.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

GithBoy_5.speaker: Player
GithBoy_5.text: Have a look at my chapter. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.

GithBoy_188.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_188.text: What is it? Is this... another part of the book?!
GithBoy_188.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy looks down at the story (unseen)

GithBoy_170.speaker: Lae'zel
GithBoy_170.text: Are you mad? This legend is a heresy to my Queen. Merely uttering his name is enough to tempt a violent fate.

GithBoy_58.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_58.text: These words, there's so much more to know about him. I can't believe it.

GithBoy_52.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_52.text: Please, let me give you the fragment I have.
GithBoy_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_184.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_184.text: Thank you, ra'stil. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.

GithBoy_39.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_39.text: Please let me give you... Wait, where is it?
GithBoy_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Varrl scratches his head, confused that his book is missing.

GithBoy_53.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_53.text: One of the others must have stolen it. Shka'keths.

GithBoy_65.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_65.text: I'll say thank you then, as that's all I have. Raz'erai'ka tavkim krash'ht.

GithBoy_43.speaker: Player
GithBoy_43.text: Have a look at my chapter. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.

GithBoy_173.speaker: Player
GithBoy_173.text: Have a look at one of my chapters. Perhaps you can find some answers in there.

GithBoy_157.speaker: Player
GithBoy_157.text: Show him the chapter you found.

GithBoy_127.speaker: Player
GithBoy_127.text: Show him one of the chapters you found.

GithBoy_22.speaker: Player
GithBoy_22.text: I might care, if you let me read your copy.

GithBoy_176.speaker: Player
GithBoy_176.text: You're right. I don't care about Orpheus. But the book is probably worth a good amount of coin. Show him the book you stole.

GithBoy_158.speaker: Player
GithBoy_158.text: So you're the k'chakhi who defaced our queen's portrait with this symbol.

GithBoy_59.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_59.text: I mean, I don't know what you're talking about.

GithBoy_169.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_169.text: Now please, I need to get these swords sharpened, or sa'varsh will sharpen them on me.

GithBoy_76.speaker: Player
GithBoy_76.text: Do others here read these Orpheus stories?

GithBoy_26.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_26.text: I don't think so. No one I've met.

GithBoy_112.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_112.text: I drew his symbol where I thought someone might see it and recognise it.

GithBoy_100.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_100.text: But nobody did. I must have the only copy.

GithBoy_104.speaker: Player
GithBoy_104.text: Yes, yes, very sad. Now about that payment you owe me...

GithBoy_167.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_167.text: I don't have anything to give you. I'm just a hatchling.

GithBoy_27.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_27.text: I thought you helped me because - because you were a good person. Like him.

GithBoy_119.speaker: Player
GithBoy_119.text: I could talk about him, if you gave me your copy to read.

GithBoy_74.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_74.text: You want me to - No, it's mine! I have to keep it safe.

GithBoy_15.speaker: Player
GithBoy_15.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your captain to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_57.speaker: Player
GithBoy_57.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_89.speaker: Player
GithBoy_89.text: Hand it over. Or should I tell your sa'varsh to come and confiscate it?

GithBoy_137.speaker: Player
GithBoy_137.text: This story deserves to be told, and stir the hearts of our kin as it has yours.

GithBoy_68.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_68.text: You'd really tell others about him? That's so brave! Please, take it.
GithBoy_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_66.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_66.text: You're a hero, just like Orpheus. Facing almost certain death to enlighten our people.
GithBoy_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player raises an eyebrow - certain death?NodeContext: In awe

GithBoy_148.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_148.text: I hope they write stories about you one day, ra'stil. I would tell them proudly.

GithBoy_191.speaker: Wyll
GithBoy_191.text: Well now - seems I'm in the presence of a gith legend in the making!

GithBoy_31.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_31.text: Really? I had no idea istiks cared about githyanki stories.
GithBoy_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_154.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_154.text: Make sure you tell it right. Don't leave anything out!

GithBoy_88.speaker: Player
GithBoy_88.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

GithBoy_23.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_23.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_185.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_185.text: It's so stupid we can't read it. It's just a story, it's not even true.

GithBoy_42.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_42.text: I'll do my best to forget what it said. Thank you for taking it.

GithBoy_131.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_131.text: Nice try. You just want the book for yourself.

GithBoy_50.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_50.text: You're sneaky and... and horrible, like all the rest of them, aren't you? Leave me alone.

GithBoy_77.speaker: Player
GithBoy_77.text: You endanger yourself by carrying this around. It must be disposed of.

GithBoy_122.speaker: Player
GithBoy_122.text: There's a powerful song to be written from this tale, one our kin deserve to hear.

GithBoy_168.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_168.text: A song? That would be so cool! Here - take it.
GithBoy_168.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy hands the chapter to the player (unseen)

GithBoy_197.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_197.text: Maybe I could write my own song about him...

GithBoy_11.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_11.text: Orpheus is so amazing. He saved us from the ghaiks' enslaving...
GithBoy_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimacesNodeContext: singing, not well, figuring it out as he goes...

GithBoy_46.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_46.text: I'm sorry. It's too dangerous. If you get caught, or they find out it was me -

GithBoy_200.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_200.text: I've already said too much. Please, don't mention his name again.

GithBoy_93.speaker: Player
GithBoy_93.text: Are you sure about that? Show him the book you stole.

GithBoy_207.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_207.text: Is that... mine? You stole it from me?

GithBoy_81.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_81.text: I - I take it back! You're nothing like him at all!

GithBoy_94.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_94.text: Whatever. Take it. Read it. Maybe you'll learn how not to be a total shka'keth!

GithBoy_175.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_175.text: No... No. I'm sorry. I can't. It's too dangerous!

GithBoy_28.speaker: Player
GithBoy_28.text: Seek the name the boy is holding back.

GithBoy_17.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_17.text: Orpheus is so complex. Even the sa'varsh wouldn't understand him.

GithBoy_195.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_195.text: What are you - are you trying to read my mind?

GithBoy_54.speaker: Player
GithBoy_54.text: Compassion? Kindness? I did it for the gold. Now pay up.

GithBoy_97.speaker: Player
GithBoy_97.text: Like Orpheus? Show the boy the chapter you stole.

GithBoy_136.speaker: Player
GithBoy_136.text: Just like who? If there's a like-minded soul here, I'd love to meet them.

GithBoy_48.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_48.text: I speak of... of Orpheus. The true prince...

GithBoy_164.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_164.text: There's nobody here like you. Trust me.
GithBoy_164.context: NodeContext: Sad - this fact disappoints him

GithBoy_151.speaker: Player
GithBoy_151.text: Empathy is a tool in any good hunter's arsenal - no different to a notched arrow.

GithBoy_85.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_85.text: That's... wise. I think. You sound just like him. Prince Orpheus.
GithBoy_85.context: NodeContext: contemplating an adage spoken by an adult, slightly confused but inquisitively so

GithBoy_3.speaker: Player
GithBoy_3.text: Your teacher has forgotten what truly makes a warrior.

GithBoy_139.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_139.text: You... You think so? What... what does it mean to be a warrior, then?
GithBoy_139.context: NodeContext: he's a tad off guard - litmus testing player to see if they are trustworthy

GithBoy_162.speaker: Player
GithBoy_162.text: A capacity for mercy is what separates us from feral beasts.

GithBoy_80.speaker: Player
GithBoy_80.text: Warriors make war. We fight for something, not just to kill.

GithBoy_115.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_115.text: Yes, you're right... There's more to it than just killing. There has to be.

GithBoy_19.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_19.text: At least, that's what Prince Orpheus says.

GithBoy_117.speaker: Player
GithBoy_117.text: Discipline - a quality your teacher obviously failed to instil.

GithBoy_172.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_172.text: Oh. Okay. Fine. I thought you might have been different. More like him.

GithBoy_105.speaker: Player
GithBoy_105.text: Seek the name the boy refuses to reveal.

GithBoy_14.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_14.text: Don't mention Orpheus. Don't mention Orpheus...
GithBoy_14.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

GithBoy_92.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_92.text: Wait! What if the sa'varsh can read my mind?!

GithBoy_12.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_12.text: Don't think about Orpheus. Don't think about Orpheus...
GithBoy_12.context: NodeContext: Scared, this name is forbidden on pain of death

GithBoy_99.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_99.text: *The boy is unconscious, the wound on his chest slowly bleeding him dry...*

GithBoy_123.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_123.text: Stop distracting me - I'm in enough trouble as it is!

GithBoy_177.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_177.text: I can't say any more, the sa'varsh might hear. Now please, let me finish my work!

GithBoy_181.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_181.text: That was amazing. I've never seen someone talk the sa'varsh down from a rage like that.

PAD_TrainingDummyComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TrainingDummyComment_0.text: A mind flayer dummy. Good for practising on.

Student04_2.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_2.text: What if I lose again? I have to train harder.

Student04_4.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_4.text: Are you from another crèche? Do you know Vlaakith?

Student04_1.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_1.text: I'm going to double my training. No, triple! I won't waste this chance.

Student04_0.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_0.text: If you see her, tell her I'm training twice as hard. No, three times as hard!

Student04_5.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_5.text: Leave me alone. I need to think.
Student04_5.context: NodeContext: in shock, trying to sound brave

Student04_6.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_6.text: Stupid Varrl. Why didn't he just kill me?
Student04_6.context: NodeContext: in shock, trying to sound brave

Student04_3.speaker: Youth Rheg'zel
Student04_3.text: The sa'varsh will make our lives miserable.

AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead_0.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherCombat_AllYouthDead_0.text: You purged the weaklings - now I will purge you!

PAD_AnatomicalSketchesComment_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AnatomicalSketchesComment_0.text: Is that what a mind flayer looks like on the inside? As if the outside wasn't disturbing enough.
PAD_AnatomicalSketchesComment_0.context: NodeContext: Karlach with an air of delight, like a kid looking at guts.

GithBoy_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_Dead_21.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

GithBoy_Dead_28.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_Dead_28.text: Refused to kill... punishment is death...

GithBoy_Dead_7.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_Dead_7.text: Refused to kill... cut down by stranger...

GithBoy_Dead_26.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_26.text: About that. My friend wants to apologise. For killing you.

GithBoy_Dead_10.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_10.text: About that. My friend wants to apologise. For accidentally killing you.

GithBoy_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_Dead_20.text: *The corpse remains silent. It waits for you to ask a question.*

GithBoy_Dead_33.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_Dead_33.text: Tired of killing... Orpheus... better way...

GithBoy_Dead_13.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_13.text: What do you think of your teacher?

GithBoy_Dead_23.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_23.text: Why were you carrying this book?

GithBoy_Dead_19.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_19.text: What can you tell me about Orpheus?

GithBoy_Dead_18.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_Dead_18.text: Lost prince... son of Gith... forbidden...

GithBoy_Dead_35.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_35.text: What do you know about Orpheus?

GithBoy_Dead_17.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_17.text: What do you think of Vlaakith?

GithBoy_Dead_29.speaker: Youth Varrl
GithBoy_Dead_29.text: Cruel queen... taints... poisons... keeps control...

GithBoy_Dead_0.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_0.text: How did you find out about Orpheus?

GithBoy_Dead_5.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_5.text: Do others here believe in Orpheus?

GithBoy_Dead_4.speaker: Player
GithBoy_Dead_4.text: Do others here read the Orpheus stories?

GithBoy_Dead_2.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_Dead_2.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

GithBoy_Dead_31.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_Dead_31.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

GithBoy_Dead_34.speaker: Narrator
GithBoy_Dead_34.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_4.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_4.text: This is only a taste of the 'mercy' a ghaik would show you.

AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_5.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_5.text: Your disobedience brings shame on Crèche Y'llek.

AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_6.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_6.text: Perhaps a tadpole has already addled your brain? Is that it?

AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_8.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
AD_TeacherBeatingBoy_8.text: K'chakhi! When you have the chance to kill your enemy, you take it!

Teacher_1.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_1.text: K'chakhi! We are training to fight ghaik. You think they will hesitate?
Teacher_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher beats a cowering student hard in the stomach with a blunt object. Other students watch this, unflinching. The teacher does not acknowledge the player.NodeContext: Angry, has been beating him, posturing for the class

Teacher_58.speaker: Youth Varrl
Teacher_58.text: They won't need to, if we keep killing each other for them! It's - it's stupid! Orph-
Teacher_58.context: NodeContext: Dizzy, scared but defiant; Boy intends to say "Orpheus says..."

Teacher_16.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_16.text: Stay out of this, istik. They need to learn what happens when they fail to follow orders.
Teacher_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher stops beating the boy, and whips around towards the player.NodeContext: Dismissive of player's interruption, with a malicious smile

Teacher_59.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_59.text: Why didn't you make the kill? My instructions were clear!

Teacher_42.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_42.text: K'chakhi! Why do you keep hesitating? My instructions were clear!
Teacher_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher beats a cowering student hard in the stomach with a blunt object. Other students watch this, unflinching. The teacher does not acknowledge the player.NodeContext: Angry, has been beating him, posturing for the class

Teacher_44.speaker: Youth Varrl
Teacher_44.text: Because - because they don't make sense! Killing each other like this, it's stupid! Orph-
Teacher_44.context: NodeContext: dizzy, scared but defiant; Boy intends to say "Orpheus says..."

Teacher_21.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_21.text: Silence! It seems your childish prattling is attracting an audience.
Teacher_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher finally acknowledges the playerNodeContext: Teacher finally acnowledges the player

Teacher_82.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_82.text: You fight again. This time, daggers only. And to the death as instructed.

Teacher_38.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_38.text: Who wants to challenge this snivelling is'tark?

Teacher_27.speaker: Player
Teacher_27.text: I'd bring him to the edge of death. Leave him asking why he deserves to live.

Teacher_83.speaker: Player
Teacher_83.text: Offer to fight the boy yourself.

Teacher_48.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_48.text: Yes, let's see how Varrl fares against the skills of a lesser crèche.

Teacher_70.speaker: Lae'zel
Teacher_70.text: Lesser? A Crèche K'liir hatchling would not have dared defy an elder.

Teacher_23.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_23.text: One bad egg does not reflect the true power of Crèche Y'llek.

Teacher_85.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_85.text: You? Tsk'va. My students do not waste their time fighting such weaklings.

Teacher_18.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_18.text: But as we seem so intent on doing things differently today, why not?
Teacher_18.context: NodeContext: Coming around to the idea after first dismissing it outright

Teacher_78.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_78.text: Take a dagger, stranger. This exercise requires nothing more than a blade, and a backbone.

Teacher_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player picks up a dagger (can be from floor, rack - cinematic preference)

Teacher_41.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_41.text: What are you waiting for? Begin!
Teacher_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boy advances, his dagger shaking but ready. Then, he drops it...

Teacher_0.speaker: Youth Varrl
Teacher_0.text: I - I refuse. There has to be a better way -

Teacher_74.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_74.text: G'lyck. Kill him, and put us all out of our misery.
Teacher_74.context: NodeContext: Teacher at the end of their rope

Teacher_8.speaker: Player
Teacher_8.text: End him! Shred him with a daggered dance!

Teacher_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stabs Varrl, revelling in his agonised screams as they twist the knife. He falls to the floor, dead.NodeContext: Actor note: after pulling the knife from the student, stand for a bit looking down at the student's corpse before walking back,

Teacher_13.speaker: Player
Teacher_13.text: There's no honour in killing a defenceless boy.

Teacher_20.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_20.text: Another who lacks the nerve? It seems Varrl's idiocy is contagious.

Teacher_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher emotionlessly runs Varrl through with his dagger. Varrl screams and falls dead to the floor.NodeContext: Actor note: The student will turn their torso to look back at the teacher right before the teacher slices their neck.

Teacher_52.speaker: Player
Teacher_52.text: Seems a little murderous to me. I'll pass.

Teacher_51.speaker: Player
Teacher_51.text: The boy's naivety is pathetic. Kill him.

Teacher_67.speaker: Wyll
Teacher_67.text: By the good gods, such cruelty. Is your soul truly this sick?

Teacher_24.speaker: Player
Teacher_24.text: Try to stop yourself. Attack without killing him.

Teacher_33.speaker: Narrator
Teacher_33.text: *You skilfully avoid hitting any major organs, but apparently it was enough. He's out cold.*

Teacher_84.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_84.text: Yet another staggering display of incompetence.
Teacher_84.context: NodeContext: With a sigh, disappointed player failed to kill Varrl

Teacher_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player stabs Varrl with the dagger. He screams and falls to the floor.NodeContext: Actor note: after pulling the knife from the student, stand for a bit looking down at the student's corpse before walking back,

Teacher_14.speaker: Narrator
Teacher_14.text: *The boy appears considerably less... alive than you were anticipating.*
Teacher_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player scratches their head/looks embarassed.

Teacher_37.speaker: Astarion
Teacher_37.text: Well look at you, killer. I didn't know you had it in you.
Teacher_37.context: NodeContext: Coyly, amused. Just watched the player accidentally kill a young gith in combat.

Teacher_63.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_63.text: A true warrior's kill: quick, bloody, and a scream to curdle the stomach juices of Vlaakith herself.

Teacher_26.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_26.text: Move him out of the way. We've wasted enough time already.

Teacher_71.speaker: Youth Astyl
Teacher_71.text: I've been practicing every night, Sa'varsh. Let me have a go.
Teacher_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Student 2 steps forward, drawing her dagger.

Teacher_29.speaker: Youth Varrl
Teacher_29.text: I - I refuse. There has to be a better way -

Teacher_22.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_22.text: You dropped your guard on your weak side and were completely open to an off-hand counter.
Teacher_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The student stabs Varrl with a dagger, killing him.NodeContext: Impossible to please

Teacher_54.speaker: Player
Teacher_54.text: If he won't fight, he's useless. Kill him yourself and be done with this.

Teacher_7.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_7.text: Yes, a demonstration may be just what's needed.

Teacher_80.speaker: Player
Teacher_80.text: Killing your own soldiers is an odd strategy for winning a war.

Teacher_72.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_72.text: Cowards are not tolerated in our ranks. Though I gather they are welcome in yours.

Teacher_69.speaker: Player
Teacher_69.text: No. This is too far. He's learnt his lesson!

Teacher_61.speaker: Player
Teacher_61.text: Leave the boy alone. You made your point.

Teacher_9.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_9.text: I suppose your inane spewings have distracted enough from my lesson.

Teacher_46.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_46.text: Go whet the swords. I want them sharp enough to peel a ghaik's eyeball just by looking at them.
Teacher_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: The teacher hits Varrl a final time, harder than any of the previous, knocking him to the ground.

Teacher_73.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_73.text: I hope you prove as weak as this should we meet on the battlefield, istik.

Teacher_28.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_28.text: I hope you do not prove this weak should we share a battlefield, ra'stil.

Teacher_60.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_60.text: And yet here you are, pathetically pleading for the same useless mercy.

Teacher_55.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
Teacher_55.text: This is how we deal with a weakened enemy -

Student01_0.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_0.text: Is that how the weakest hatchlings are treated in your crèche? I suppose that explains why you made it out alive.

Student01_2.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_2.text: Why didn't you stab him properly?

Student01_5.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_5.text: All that waiting around, just to watch Varrl take a nap.

Student01_3.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_3.text: Stop bothering me. I'm trying to concentrate!

Student01_4.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_4.text: If you're here to see the sa'varsh, you'll have to wait until he's 'made his point.'

Student01_6.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_6.text: Please. I have a dagger in my hand. I'd hate to injure an honoured guest from another crèche.
Student01_6.context: NodeContext: subtle threat, getting annoyed at the player

Student01_7.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_7.text: I liked your technique. Not how I would have done it, but still quite impressive.
Student01_7.context: NodeContext: Arrogant, reluctantly giving a compliment

Student01_9.speaker: Youth Ba'akreth
Student01_9.text: Did you see that? The look on Varrl's face when the blade went in...

PAD_Combat_TeacherAbilityReaction_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Combat_TeacherAbilityReaction_0.text: They'll do their teacher's bidding. Bad for us.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_1.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_1.text: I must attend to my students. Be on your way.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_49.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_49.text: Happy to help. The students didn't seem to be learning much from you.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_37.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_37.text: The boy was a liability. I did what was necessary.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_46.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_46.text: Precisely. The foe he spares may be the one to rise up and tear out your gullet.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_35.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_35.text: I've heard reports that ghaik are operating here on an unprecedented scale. They must not be allowed to gain a foothold.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_10.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_10.text: But that is for the kith'rak to worry about. My job is to forge the blade, not to decide how it is wielded.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_10.context: NodeContext: Gave away too much, drawing an end to the conversation

TeacherAfterBoyScene_52.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_52.text: Did you know the boy was a believer in Orpheus?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_81.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_81.text: A ridiculous notion. No student of mine would be permitted to indulge such heresies.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_73.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_73.text: The name pollutes the very air expelled in its uttering.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_45.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_45.text: The hatchlings live to serve Vlaakith, or they do not live at all.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_29.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_29.text: Why was the boy refusing to fight?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_13.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_13.text: I have no interests in whatever delusional beliefs the boy harboured.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_17.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_17.text: There are signs that the ghaik presence here goes beyond their usual predation. They are converging on something.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_57.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_57.text: The illithids infecting this region are not to be reasoned with. They are to be exterminated.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_51.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_51.text: If the boy was too stupid to realise this, his death is a mercy for the warrior next to him.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_58.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_58.text: What is it? These insufferable interruptions are distracting from my lessons.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_48.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_48.text: I do what is necessary, and no worse than our enemies would do.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_33.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_33.text: Our warriors must possess strength and skill far superior to any spawned from this putrescent plane.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_31.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_31.text: You will learn this first-hand, istik, when we finally come to claim it for our own.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_41.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_41.text: Did they do things so differently when you were a hatchling?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_30.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_30.text: Chk. Your pathetic intervention spoke for itself - only a lesser crèche would indulge such lenience.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_62.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_62.text: There are whispers of ghaik gathering in unusual numbers nearby. They are not here to negotiate.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_63.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_63.text: We will eradicate them, ra'stil, and when we do, you will be grateful our warriors are so carefully chosen.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_63.context: NodeContext: smug, thinks his are the best warriors

TeacherAfterBoyScene_54.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_54.text: I doubt it will matter. Your hatchlings are not fit to serve Vlaakith.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_7.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_7.text: My students earn the most silver swords of any crèche under Vlaakith's command.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_18.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_18.text: Their potential may not be apparent to your untrained eye, but my methods never fail to extract it.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_28.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_28.text: It is up to them to deliver on this potential. They know the punishment if they fail.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_26.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_26.text: I'm curious. Why make them fight to the death?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_71.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_71.text: Our wars are waged against ghaik, not bandits and petty thieves.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_71.context: NodeContext: Sneering, implying this is all the player is fit for

TeacherAfterBoyScene_44.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_44.text: The slightest mistake, the smallest hesitation, and you die. The warrior next to you dies. A hundred more behind them.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_20.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_20.text: So we ensure that in our ranks, there are no mistakes.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_40.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_40.text: I wouldn't expect an istik to understand. On this plane, inadequacy is expected.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_27.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_27.text: Do you know the boy has been reading about Orpheus?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_15.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_15.text: Chk. Do not dare speak of that pustulent poet in my training room.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_43.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_43.text: I will find out if Varrl has truly succumbed to the vile canker of that heretic's words.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_43.context: NodeContext: as if "poet" is the most disgusting insult of all

TeacherAfterBoyScene_50.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_50.text: If I am not convinced of his loyalty to our glorious queen, then I will cure him.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_50.context: NodeContext: ominous - this won't be fun for Varrl

TeacherAfterBoyScene_36.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_36.text: Chk! Not just a coward, but a heretic too.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_36.context: NodeContext: Slightly worried - this makes him look bad.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_12.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_12.text: That kainchi poet is no more tolerated in my training room than a ghaik would be tolerated on Vlaakith's throne.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_12.context: NodeContext: as if "poet" is the most disgusting insult of all

TeacherAfterBoyScene_11.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_11.text: I will rectify his behaviour. Swiftly and painfully.
TeacherAfterBoyScene_11.context: NodeContext: ominous - this won't be fun for Varrl

TeacherAfterBoyScene_38.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_38.text: Does your kith'rak know you tolerate your students reading the Orpheus myths?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_14.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_14.text: Why was the boy refusing to kill?

TeacherAfterBoyScene_4.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_4.text: For his sake, I hope it was a moment of temporary insanity.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_9.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_9.text: If he has not regained his senses by the time he rejoins my training, his return will be a short and painful one.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_72.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_72.text: Did you enjoy our little demonstration? A mere taste of the power Crèche Y'llek commands.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_24.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_24.text: If that display was a 'taste of Crèche Y'llek's power', I've nothing to worry about.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_75.speaker: Player
TeacherAfterBoyScene_75.text: Vlaakith would delight in your ruthlessness here, I'm sure.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_39.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_39.text: I am a humble blade tasked with carving out an army.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_34.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_34.text: Every bit of waste I trim away brings us closer to victory against the ghaik infesting these lands.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_78.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_78.text: I hear they have been gathering nearby in greater numbers than usual.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_76.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_76.text: There should be plenty of heads for my students to take when their final test begins.

TeacherAfterBoyScene_25.speaker: Sa'varsh Kethk
TeacherAfterBoyScene_25.context: NodeContext: Determined, he passsionately follows Vlaakith
